etymology.description: Depicts two 十(十) (shí, "ten") written side by side, with a horizontal stroke at the bottom that fuses them
etymology.interpretation: The character 廿(廿) (niàn, "twenty") directly represents the number twenty by combining two tens ten (十) together and connecting them, illustrating the concept of two tens forming twenty.

examples.chinese: 我今年廿岁(我今年廿歲)，准备考大学(準備考大學)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jīnnián niàn suì, zhǔnbèi kǎo dàxué.
examples.english: I am twenty years old this year and I am preparing for college.

examples.chinese: 放学钟响时(放學鐘響時)，他收到廿个红包(他收到廿個紅包)。
examples.pinyin: Fàngxué zhōng xiǎng shí, tā shōudào niàn gè hóngbāo.
examples.english: When the school bell rings, he receives twenty red envelopes.
